title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: The first pool on this water is the Kampling, from the number of ramps, or wild onions, which grow abundantly on the south side. The Ashiestiel boat pool, on the side of which you see the oak tree (not a huge tree), where, we are informed by Lockhart, Sir Walter Scott sat often while he was composing Marmion The Gullets at the Bridge, Moss, and Nedpath pools, follow, the last of which is on Fairnilee water, the property of Mrs Pringle of Haining.
